references.paper_title: A survey of large language models
references.reason: This survey provides a comprehensive overview of large language models, which are fundamental to the computer-using agents discussed in the paper.

references.paper_title: Ufo: A ui-focused agent for windows os interaction
references.reason: This paper introduces UFO, a foundational UI-focused agent for Windows, which serves as a direct precursor and inspiration for the current work, UFO2.

references.paper_title: The dawn of lmms: Preliminary explorations with gpt-4v (ision)
references.reason: This paper discusses the capabilities of GPT-4V, a key vision-language model used in the current paper for GUI understanding and action planning.

references.paper_title: React: Synergizing reasoning and acting in language models
references.reason: This paper introduces the ReAct framework, a crucial component used in the paper for enabling agents to reason and act iteratively within application environments.

references.paper_title: Osworld: Benchmarking multimodal agents for open-ended tasks in real computer environments
references.reason: This paper introduces the OSWorld benchmark, one of the primary benchmarks used in the current paper for evaluating the performance of UFO2.
